title: Dow Jones Futures Signal Strong Gains For Post-Coronavirus Stock Market Rally Ahead Of Jobs Report; Will Tesla Plant Reopen Today?
summary:
Roku stock, Trade Desk stock, Insulet stock, Qualys stock and Avalara stock cleared buy points intraday Thursday just before earnings.
Bring Your 'A' Game To Post-Coronavirus Stock Market RallyTrade Desk stock, Qualys stock and Inphi stock boast 98 IBD Composite Ratings out of a best-possible 99.
Remember that overnight action in Dow futures, Roku stock, Trade Desk stock and elsewhere doesn't necessarily translate into actual trading in the next regular stock market session.
Post-Coronavirus Stock Market RallyThe post-coronavirus stock market rally had yet another strong session.
Like Roku stock, Trade Desk stock is coming out of a deep base (58%).
text:
Dow Jones futures rose solidly early Friday, along with S&P 500 futures and Nasdaq futures, ahead of a historically bad jobs report and with uncertainty surrounding Tesla (TSLA) and its Fremont, California plant. That follows a strong day for the post-coronavirus stock market with the Nasdaq turning positive for 2020.

X

Roku (ROKU), Insulet (PODD), Trade Desk (TTD), Inphi (IPHI), Qualys (QLYS) and Avalara (AVLR) all reported earnings late Thursday.

Roku stock, Trade Desk stock, Insulet stock, Qualys stock and Avalara stock cleared buy points intraday Thursday just before earnings. But four of these five "can't-wait-for-earnings" breakouts, while AVLR stock initially sank before moving slightly higher. The overall moves highlight that buying ahead of earnings is very risky.

Meanwhile, chip leader Inphi stock rose overnight. IPHI stock had closed well above its early-April breakout.

Several of these companies — including IPHI stock, TTD stock, QLYS stock and AVLR stock — have relative strength lines at or near record highs, a bullish sign. The RS line tracks a stock's performance vs. the S&P 500 index. The RS line for Roku stock is not at a consolidation high, but is at a short-term peak.

Tesla Fremont Plant

Tesla CEO Elon Musk reportedly aims to restart the Fremont plant by Friday afternoon, according to an email to workers. The Fremont plant will resume with "limited operations" with about 30% of workers for a normal shift, according to the company. But will it?

The main Tesla manufacturing facility has been closed since March 23 due to a "stay-at-home" order from Alameda County. Gov. Gavin Newsom on Thursday said he would allow manufacturing to resume in California, but noted that local rules take precedence. So far Alameda County and other Bay Area counties and San Francisco haven't signaled they're ready to lift local bans on nonessential businesses, which currently runs through May 31. Then again, Musk defied the local order in March, keeping the Tesla Fremont plant open for another week.

Meanwhile, the Tesla Shanghai plant has been shut down beyond an early May holiday period. There have been reports that the Shanghai plant is running out of pants sourced from the U.S., though Tesla denies that's the reason. The Tesla gigafactory outside of Reno, Nevada, also closed down, supplies battery cells, while many other U.S. suppliers have gone dark

Tesla stock rose 1% in the premarket. TSLA stock is consolidating just below 800 following a recent breakout attempt that quickly failed.

Bring Your 'A' Game To Post-Coronavirus Stock Market Rally

Trade Desk stock, Qualys stock and Inphi stock boast 98 IBD Composite Ratings out of a best-possible 99. Tesla stock has a 97 Composite Rating, thanks to some recent profits and massive, whipsaw stock gains in the last several months. Avalara stock has a solid 91 Composite Rating, though it is not profitable. Insulet stock and Cloudflare stock have decent 81 Composite Ratings.

With so many stocks breaking out in the post-coronavirus market rally, investors should be focusing on A-quality names, with strong growth, institutional support and better chart patterns. Roku stock, which corrected 65% during the coronavirus market crash, has been a huge winner at times, but the money-losing stock is tremendously volatile.

Contrast that to profitable leaders such as Microsoft (MSFT), ServiceNow (NOW) and Apple (AAPL), which have corrected a relatively modest 31%, 34% and 35%, respectively. All three stocks have broken out over the last several sessions. Their RS lines are at record highs.

Microsoft stock and Apple stock are both trillion-dollar companies and members of the Dow Jones, S&P 500 index and Nasdaq composite. It doesn't get much more institutional than that.

Microsoft stock, ServiceNow stock and Apple stock are all on IBD Leaderboard. MSFT stock and NOW stock are on the IBD Long-Term Leaders list.

If you do buy more speculative names like Roku stock, keep them at a relatively small share of your portfolio.

Dow Jones Futures Today

Dow Jones futures rose 1% vs. fair value. S&P 500 futures climbed 1.1%. Nasdaq 100 futures advanced 1.1%. During the post-coronavirus stock market rally, Dow Jones futures have been less prone to the whipsaw moves of the recent market crash. But big overnight moves are not uncommon, with Dow futures picking up steam Thursday morning, foreshadowing Thursday's strong market rally.

Remember that overnight action in Dow futures, Roku stock, Trade Desk stock and elsewhere doesn't necessarily translate into actual trading in the next regular stock market session.

April Jobs Report

The April jobs report will loom large over Dow Jones futures Friday, morning, coming out at 8:30 a.m. ET. Economists expect nonfarm payrolls plunged by 21.5 million, with unemployment soaring to 16.4%. But huge job losses will likely continue, at least in the short run. Hence the enormous pressure to reopen the economy, ready or not.

Join IBD experts as they analyze actionable stocks in the coronavirus stock market rally on IBD Live.

Coronavirus News

Coronavirus cases worldwide have topped 3.93 million. Covid-19 deaths have reached 271,000.

Coronavirus cases in the U.S. have climbed to 1.29 million, with deaths above 76,000.

Post-Coronavirus Stock Market Rally

The post-coronavirus stock market rally had yet another strong session.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.9%, and the S&P 500 index tacked on 1.15%. The Nasdaq composite advanced 1.4% after topping 9,000 intraday.

The Nasdaq is now positive for 2020, a remarkable recovery from the coronavirus market crash. The Nasdaq's 50-day moving average is set to turn higher on Friday, reinforcing the bullish trend for the post-coronavirus stock market rally.

PayPal (PYPL), Fortinet (FTNT) and Twilio (TWLO) gapped out of bases, while Peloton (PTON) and Livongo Health (LVGO) kept soaring. Several other stocks cleared buy points or extended breakouts.

Apple stock rose 1% and ServiceNow stock advanced 4.5%, both fractionally beyond the 5% chase zone. Microsoft stock edged up 0.6%, but has rallied 5.2% for the week. MSFT is still in range from a 180.10 handle in a double-bottom base.

Among the best ETFs, the Innovator IBD 50 ETF (FFTY) rallied 2.2%. The iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV) popped 2.6%, as software has been hot in the post-coronavirus market rally. Microsoft stock and ServiceNow stock are notable holdings. The VanEck Vectors Semiconductor ETF (SMH) rose 0.9%.

Read The Big Picture every day to stay in sync with the market direction and leading stocks and sectors.

Why The Shelf Pattern Is The Perfect Pyramiding Tool In Growth Stocks

Roku Earnings

Roku earnings came in at an adjusted loss of 45 cents vs. a 9-cent loss a year earlier. Revenue grew 55% to $320.8 million. Wall Street had forecast a 45-cent loss on sales of $306.7 million.

While profitability is a long way off, the streaming platform leader is seeing booming use during the stay-at-home coronavirus shutdowns. Operating costs shot up 76%.

Roku stock fell 8% before Friday's open. On Thursday, Roku stock popped 7.8% to 137.50, clearing a 135.57 handle buy point as well as a downward-sloping trend line.

Trade Desk Earnings

Trade Desk earnings surged 84% to 90 cents a share, with revenue up 33% to $160.7 million. Analysts expected Trade Desk earnings of 38 cents on sales of $158.3 million

The maker of digital advertising tools didn't provide guidance due to the coronavirus.

Trade Desk stock retreated 8% in the premarket. TTD stock rose 3.3% Thursday to 322.50. Intraday, Trade Desk stock hit 327.35, briefly moving above a V-shaped cup-base buy point of 323.88, according to MarketSmith analysis.

Like Roku stock, Trade Desk stock is coming out of a deep base (58%). Unlike Roku stock, TTD stock is at a new high, so it doesn't have overhead resistance. But by running up so fast from the bottom, Trade Desk stock is vulnerable to a pullback.

Insulet Earnings

Insulet earnings turned out to be a 3-cent loss as revenue grew 24% to $198 million Analysts expected break-even Insulet earnings with sales at $190 million.

The insulin pump maker now sees 2020 revenue rising 15% in constant currency, at the low end of its February forecast for 15%-19% growth.

Insulet stock fell in extended trade, with a wide bid-and-ask spread. PODD stock rallied 4.2% to 215.15 on Thursday, breaking out from a 209.94 cup-with-handle buy point.

Insulet stock is one of a trio of diabetes products leaders. Dexcom (DXCM) has been the clear standout. Dexcom stock leapt 10% Thursday on news it'll join the S&P 500 index. DXCM is well extended. Tandem Diabetes stock rose nearly 3%, running toward a buy point in a cup base.

Livongo, which makes remote monitoring products for chronic diseases including diabetes, is also in the general field.

Qualys Earnings

Qualys earnings rose 33% to 65 cents a share. Revenue climbed 14.5% to $86.3 million. Wall Street expected Qualys earnings of 60 cents on sales of $85.8 million

The cybersecurity firm guided slightly higher on Q2 EPS but slightly lower for revenue.

Qualys stock plunged 8.4% overnight. QLYS stock popped 5.5% to 111.25 on Thursday, clearing a 110.99 alternative entry from a short consolidation. That was on top of a cup-base breakout with a 94.82 buy point.

Avalara Earnings

Avalara earnings came in at a 5-cent loss vs. a 3-cent loss a year earlier. Revenue rose 31% to $111.4 million. Analysts expected an 11-cent loss on $108.4 million in revenue.

The maker of tax compliance automation software, citing the coronavirus crisis, guided slightly lower on Q2 revenue and roughly in line for full-year revenue.

Avalara stock initially sold off after hours, but rallied to move slightly higher. AVLR stock rose 9.3% to 101.76 on Thursday, breaking out above a 97.06 cup-base entry.

Inphi Earnings

Inphi earnings leapt 88% to 62 cents a share as revenue surged 70% to $139.4 million. Analysts saw Inphi earnings at 57 cents on sales of $137.9 million.

The data-center chipmaker also guided higher for Q2 EPS and sales.

Inphi stock rose 11% before the open. IPHI stock climbed 2.75% to 98.97 on Thursday, near recent highs.

Inphi stock corrected 40% during the coronavirus market crash, but has roared back. Its RS line was already at new highs before Inphi stock broke out on April 3.

<div class="single-post-content post-content drop-cap">
<p>Dow Jones futures rose solidly early Friday, along with S&P 500 futures and Nasdaq futures, ahead of a historically bad jobs report and with uncertainty surrounding <strong>Tesla</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=TSLA' target='_blank'>TSLA</a>) and its Fremont, California plant. That follows a strong day for the post-coronavirus stock market with the Nasdaq turning positive for 2020.</p>

<p><strong>Roku</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=ROKU' target='_blank'>ROKU</a>), <strong>Insulet</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=PODD' target='_blank'>PODD</a>), <strong>Trade Desk</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=TTD' target='_blank'>TTD</a>), <strong>Inphi</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=IPHI' target='_blank'>IPHI</a>), <strong>Qualys</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=QLYS' target='_blank'>QLYS</a>) and <strong>Avalara</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AVLR' target='_blank'>AVLR</a>) all reported earnings late Thursday.</p>
<p>Roku stock, Trade Desk stock, Insulet stock, Qualys stock and Avalara stock cleared buy points intraday Thursday just before earnings. But four of these five "can't-wait-for-earnings" breakouts, while AVLR stock initially sank before moving slightly higher. The overall moves highlight that buying ahead of earnings is very risky.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, chip leader Inphi stock rose overnight. IPHI stock had closed well above its early-April breakout.</p>
<p>Several of these companies — including IPHI stock, TTD stock, QLYS stock and AVLR stock — have <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/a-stock-breakout-specialty-tool-the-relative-strength-line/">relative strength lines</a> at or near record highs, a bullish sign. The RS line tracks a stock's performance vs. the S&P 500 index. The RS line for Roku stock is not at a consolidation high, but is at a short-term peak.</p>

<h2>Tesla Fremont Plant</h2>
<p>Tesla CEO Elon Musk reportedly aims to restart the Fremont plant by Friday afternoon, according to an email to workers. The Fremont plant will resume with "limited operations" with about 30% of workers for a normal shift, according to the company. But will it?</p>
<p>The main Tesla manufacturing facility has been closed since March 23 due to a "stay-at-home" order from Alameda County. Gov. Gavin Newsom on Thursday said he would allow manufacturing to resume in California, but noted that local rules take precedence. So far Alameda County and other Bay Area counties and San Francisco haven't signaled they're ready to lift local bans on nonessential businesses, which currently runs through May 31. Then again, Musk defied the local order in March, keeping the Tesla Fremont plant open for another week.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, the Tesla Shanghai plant has been shut down beyond an early May holiday period. There have been reports that the Shanghai plant is running out of pants sourced from the U.S., though Tesla denies that's the reason. The Tesla gigafactory outside of Reno, Nevada, also closed down, supplies battery cells, while many other U.S. suppliers have gone dark</p>
<p>Tesla stock rose 1% in the premarket. TSLA stock is consolidating just below 800 following a recent breakout attempt that quickly failed.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=tsla'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Bring Your 'A' Game To Post-Coronavirus Stock Market Rally</h2>
<p>Trade Desk stock, Qualys stock and Inphi stock boast 98 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-research-growth-stocks/">IBD Composite Ratings</a> out of a best-possible 99. Tesla stock has a 97 Composite Rating, thanks to some recent profits and massive, whipsaw stock gains in the last several months. Avalara stock has a solid 91 Composite Rating, though it is not profitable. Insulet stock and Cloudflare stock have decent 81 Composite Ratings.</p>
<p>With so many stocks breaking out in the post-coronavirus market rally, investors should be focusing on A-quality names, with strong growth, institutional support and better chart patterns. Roku stock, which corrected 65% during the coronavirus market crash, has been a huge winner at times, but the money-losing stock is tremendously volatile.</p>
<p>Contrast that to profitable leaders such as <strong>Microsoft</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=MSFT' target='_blank'>MSFT</a>), <strong>ServiceNow</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=NOW' target='_blank'>NOW</a>) and <strong>Apple</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AAPL' target='_blank'>AAPL</a>), which have corrected a relatively modest 31%, 34% and 35%, respectively. All three stocks have broken out over the last several sessions. Their RS lines are at record highs.</p>
<p>Microsoft stock and Apple stock are both trillion-dollar companies and members of the Dow Jones, S&P 500 index and Nasdaq composite. It doesn't get much more institutional than that.</p>
<p>Microsoft stock, ServiceNow stock and Apple stock are all on <a href="https://leaderboard.investors.com/#/leaders/leadersnearabuypoint">IBD Leaderboard</a>. MSFT stock and NOW stock are on the <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/ibd-long-term-leaders-screen/">IBD Long-Term Leaders list</a>.</p>
<p>If you do buy more speculative names like Roku stock, keep them at a relatively small share of your portfolio.</p>
<h2>Dow Jones Futures Today</h2>
<p>Dow Jones futures rose 1% vs. fair value. S&P 500 futures climbed 1.1%. Nasdaq 100 futures advanced 1.1%. During the post-coronavirus stock market rally, Dow Jones futures have been less prone to the whipsaw moves of the recent market crash. But big overnight moves are not uncommon, with Dow futures picking up steam Thursday morning, foreshadowing Thursday's strong market rally.</p>
<p>Remember that overnight action in <a href="http://www.investors.com/market-trend/stock-market-today/stock-futures-premarket-dow-futures-sp-futures-nasdaq-futures/">Dow futures</a>, Roku stock, Trade Desk stock and elsewhere doesn't necessarily translate into actual trading in the next regular <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/stock-market-data-dow-jones-sp-500-nasdaq-spdr-etfs/">stock market</a> session.</p>
<h2>April Jobs Report</h2>
<p>The April jobs report will loom large over Dow Jones futures Friday, morning, coming out at 8:30 a.m. ET. Economists expect nonfarm payrolls plunged by 21.5 million, with unemployment soaring to 16.4%. But huge job losses will likely continue, at least in the short run. Hence the enormous pressure to reopen the economy, ready or not.</p>

<h2>Coronavirus News</h2>
<p>Coronavirus cases worldwide have topped 3.93 million. Covid-19 deaths have reached 271,000.</p>
<p>Coronavirus cases in the U.S. have climbed to 1.29 million, with deaths above 76,000.</p>
<h2>Post-Coronavirus Stock Market Rally</h2>
<p>The post-coronavirus stock market rally had yet another strong session.</p>
<p>The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.9%, and the S&P 500 index tacked on 1.15%. The Nasdaq composite advanced 1.4% after topping 9,000 intraday.</p>
<p>The Nasdaq is now positive for 2020, a remarkable recovery from the coronavirus market crash. The Nasdaq's 50-day moving average is set to turn higher on Friday, reinforcing the bullish trend for the post-coronavirus stock market rally.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=0ndqc'></iframe></div></div>
<p><strong>PayPal</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=PYPL' target='_blank'>PYPL</a>), <strong>Fortinet</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=FTNT' target='_blank'>FTNT</a>) and <strong>Twilio</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=TWLO' target='_blank'>TWLO</a>) gapped out of bases, while <strong>Peloton</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=PTON' target='_blank'>PTON</a>) and <strong>Livongo Health</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=LVGO' target='_blank'>LVGO</a>) kept soaring. Several other stocks cleared buy points or extended breakouts.</p>
<p>Apple stock rose 1% and ServiceNow stock advanced 4.5%, both fractionally beyond the 5% chase zone. Microsoft stock edged up 0.6%, but has rallied 5.2% for the week. MSFT is still in range from a 180.10 handle in a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/when-buy-growth-stocks-why-double-bottom-base-fuels-strong-breakouts/">double-bottom base</a>.</p>
<p>Among the <a href="https://www.investors.com/etfs-and-funds/etfs/best-etfs-exchange-traded-funds/">best ETFs</a>, the Innovator IBD 50 ETF (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=FFTY' target='_blank'>FFTY</a>) rallied 2.2%. The iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=IGV' target='_blank'>IGV</a>) popped 2.6%, as software has been hot in the post-coronavirus market rally. Microsoft stock and ServiceNow stock are notable holdings. The VanEck Vectors Semiconductor ETF (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=SMH' target='_blank'>SMH</a>) rose 0.9%.</p>
<p>Read <a href="https://www.investors.com/category/market-trend/the-big-picture/">The Big Picture</a> every day to stay in sync with the market direction and leading stocks and sectors.</p>

<h2>Roku Earnings</h2>
<p>Roku earnings came in at an adjusted loss of 45 cents vs. a 9-cent loss a year earlier. Revenue grew 55% to $320.8 million. Wall Street had forecast a 45-cent loss on sales of $306.7 million.</p>
<p>While profitability is a long way off, the streaming platform leader is seeing booming use during the stay-at-home coronavirus shutdowns. Operating costs shot up 76%.</p>
<p>Roku stock fell 8% before Friday's open. On Thursday, Roku stock popped 7.8% to 137.50, clearing a 135.57 handle <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/chart-reading-basics-how-a-buy-point-marks-a-time-of-opportunity/">buy point</a> as well as a downward-sloping trend line.</p>
<h2>Trade Desk Earnings</h2>
<p>Trade Desk earnings surged 84% to 90 cents a share, with revenue up 33% to $160.7 million. Analysts expected Trade Desk earnings of 38 cents on sales of $158.3 million</p>
<p>The maker of digital advertising tools didn't provide guidance due to the coronavirus.</p>
<p>Trade Desk stock retreated 8% in the premarket. TTD stock rose 3.3% Thursday to 322.50. Intraday, Trade Desk stock hit 327.35, briefly moving above a V-shaped <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/corner-cup-without-handle/">cup-base</a> buy point of 323.88, according to <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/marketsmith/?artProdLink=MarketSmith">MarketSmith analysis</a>.</p>
<p>Like Roku stock, Trade Desk stock is coming out of a deep base (58%). Unlike Roku stock, TTD stock is at a new high, so it doesn't have overhead resistance. But by running up so fast from the bottom, Trade Desk stock is vulnerable to a pullback.</p>
<h2>Insulet Earnings</h2>
<p>Insulet earnings turned out to be a 3-cent loss as revenue grew 24% to $198 million Analysts expected break-even Insulet earnings with sales at $190 million.</p>
<p>The insulin pump maker now sees 2020 revenue rising 15% in constant currency, at the low end of its February forecast for 15%-19% growth.</p>
<p>Insulet stock fell in extended trade, with a wide bid-and-ask spread. PODD stock rallied 4.2% to 215.15 on Thursday, breaking out from a 209.94 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-buy-stocks-cup-with-handle-base-alibaba-stock-buy-point/">cup-with-handle</a> buy point.</p>
<p>Insulet stock is one of a trio of diabetes products leaders. <strong>Dexcom</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=DXCM' target='_blank'>DXCM</a>) has been the clear standout. Dexcom stock leapt 10% Thursday on news it'll join the S&P 500 index. DXCM is well extended. Tandem Diabetes stock rose nearly 3%, running toward a buy point in a cup base.</p>
<p>Livongo, which makes remote monitoring products for chronic diseases including diabetes, is also in the general field.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=podd'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Qualys Earnings</h2>
<p>Qualys earnings rose 33% to 65 cents a share. Revenue climbed 14.5% to $86.3 million. Wall Street expected Qualys earnings of 60 cents on sales of $85.8 million</p>
<p>The cybersecurity firm guided slightly higher on Q2 EPS but slightly lower for revenue.</p>
<p>Qualys stock plunged 8.4% overnight. QLYS stock popped 5.5% to 111.25 on Thursday, clearing a 110.99 alternative entry from a short consolidation. That was on top of a cup-base breakout with a 94.82 buy point.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=qlys'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Avalara Earnings</h2>
<p>Avalara earnings came in at a 5-cent loss vs. a 3-cent loss a year earlier. Revenue rose 31% to $111.4 million. Analysts expected an 11-cent loss on $108.4 million in revenue.</p>
<p>The maker of tax compliance automation software, citing the coronavirus crisis, guided slightly lower on Q2 revenue and roughly in line for full-year revenue.</p>
<p>Avalara stock initially sold off after hours, but rallied to move slightly higher. AVLR stock rose 9.3% to 101.76 on Thursday, breaking out above a 97.06 cup-base entry.</p>
<h2>Inphi Earnings</h2>
<p>Inphi earnings leapt 88% to 62 cents a share as revenue surged 70% to $139.4 million. Analysts saw Inphi earnings at 57 cents on sales of $137.9 million.</p>
<p>The data-center chipmaker also guided higher for Q2 EPS and sales.</p>
<p>Inphi stock rose 11% before the open. IPHI stock climbed 2.75% to 98.97 on Thursday, near recent highs.</p>
<p>Inphi stock corrected 40% during the coronavirus market crash, but has roared back. Its RS line was already at new highs before Inphi stock broke out on April 3.</p>
